data.title: Shift Register
data.statement:
Your goal is to simulate a shift register circuit.

Given a known starting state [[state]] of every 'bit', the number [[n]] of bits in the string, and a string [[shifts]] consisting of a series of data inputs and number representing clock toggles, generate a sequence of 1s and 0s representing the highs and lows of the final state of the circuit.  The length of the sequence should not change - least significant bits fall into the bit bucket when shifted out.

For example:
[[state]] = H
[[n]] = 8
[[shifts]] = L3H1L2

With a starting HIGH state and 8 total bits, the sequence will look like <<11111111>>
The first pair of elements in [[shifts]] says the data input will be toggled LOW and the clock will be pulsed 3 times, resulting in a sequence of <<00011111>>
The next pair of elements in [[shifts]] says the data input will be toggled HIGH and the clock will be pulsed once, resulting in a sequence of <<10001111>>
The next and final pair of elements in [[shifts]] says the data input will be toggled LOW and the clock will be pulsed twice, resulting in a sequence of <<00100011>>
Therefore, the output should be <<00100011>>
data.constraints:
[[state]] is either {{H}} or {{L}}
1 <= [[n]] <= 100
[[shifts]] contains only the uppercase letters {{H}} and {{L}}, and single-digit integers ({{0-9}})
2 <= length of [[shifts]] <= 250
Length of [[shifts]] is always even
data.stubGenerator:
read state:string(1)
read n:int
read shifts:string(250)

write New sequence of 1s and 0s after shifts
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1 - >> A single character [[state]], either {{H}} or {{L}} for the HIGH or LOW (1 or 0) starting state
<<Line 2 - >> A single positive integer [[n]] for the number of bits
<<Line 3 - >> A string [[shifts]] alternating between a letter, either {{H}} or {{L}} for the data input, and an integer {{0-9}} for the number of clock toggles
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1 - >> A string consisting of {{0}}s and {{1}}s after completing shifts according to the input string [[shifts]]

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Your goal is to simulate a shift register circuit.

Given a known starting state state of every 'bit', the number n of bits in the string, and a string shifts consisting of a series of data inputs and number representing clock toggles, generate a sequence of 1s and 0s representing the highs and lows of the final state of the circuit. The length of the sequence should not change - least significant bits fall into the bit bucket when shifted out.

For example:
state = H
n = 8
shifts = L3H1L2

With a starting HIGH state and 8 total bits, the sequence will look like 11111111
The first pair of elements in shifts says the data input will be toggled LOW and the clock will be pulsed 3 times, resulting in a sequence of 00011111
The next pair of elements in shifts says the data input will be toggled HIGH and the clock will be pulsed once, resulting in a sequence of 10001111
The next and final pair of elements in shifts says the data input will be toggled LOW and the clock will be pulsed twice, resulting in a sequence of 00100011
Therefore, the output should be 00100011
Input
Line 1 - A single character state, either H or L for the HIGH or LOW (1 or 0) starting state
Line 2 - A single positive integer n for the number of bits
Line 3 - A string shifts alternating between a letter, either H or L for the data input, and an integer 0-9 for the number of clock toggles
Output
Line 1 - A string consisting of 0s and 1s after completing shifts according to the input string shifts
Constraints
state is either H or L
1 <= n <= 100
shifts contains only the uppercase letters H and L, and single-digit integers (0-9)
2 <= length of shifts <= 250
Length of shifts is always even
Example
Input
H
8
L3H1L2
Output
00100011
